attributes.action: Vote on whether the Houses of Parliament should be refurbished or rebuilt.
attributes.background: In a time of mass austerity, £4b to refurbish The Houses of Parliament over 6 years NOT including fees for renting elsewhere. £7.1b over 32 years if they stay inside. We the people believe that the palace should be kept for historical value and a new building be built for a fraction of the price.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is there. This needs to be done and the savings go back into the publics purse, helping stop austerity on the sick and disabled. Fund more homeless shelters, stock the food banks!!! Act NOW not tomorrow!

http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/708740/houses-of-parliament-restoration-48bn-to-do-list-westminster

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/parliament-refurbishment-7bn-westminster-revamp-faces-three-year-delay-a6872141.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37303682

attributes.action: Make learning a foreign language compulsory from the 1st year of primary school
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest levels of multi-linguistic speakers. By keeping up with our European neighbours we will open up travel for the individual and business for the nation. The best way to learn a foreign language is to learn continuously from a young age, when the brain is most capable.
attributes.additional_details: Communication is key in international business and the UK government wishes to see more students taking up a foreign language at university. To facilitate a future nation of polyglots we need to prioritise foreign language as a core subject for children. Starting from the age of 5, or younger, when it's easiest to learn, and to be taught continuously through to adolescence so that every future adult has at least basic secondary language skills.

attributes.action: Implement a detection system to stop parental abduction of children leaving U.K
attributes.background: The government needs to implement a no nonsense approach to stopping one parent abducting a child to another country at Airports and all points of travel especially holiday seasons. Systems as such already exist in Canada, US and even in the Middle East.
attributes.additional_details:
Government needs to make sure kids cannot leave from the U.K without the consent of both parents 
"Nobody asked if he had my permission to take her" 
Sarah Taylor Rise in parental child abductions 
Foreign Office figures that show that the number of British children abducted by a parent and taken overseas has increased in the past year. 
A mother's lengthy search for her kidnapped child-http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk

attributes.action: Invoke NATO Article 4 consultation on establishing a "No-Fly" zone over Syria.
attributes.background: Syrian and Russian airstrikes target civilian population centres, schools and medical centres, weaponising refugees and making living in non government areas untenable. This not only constitutes a warcrime but effectively endangers NATO and EU cohesion, as a planned and desired secondary objective.
attributes.additional_details:
A "No-Fly" zone would force the Syrian and Russian regime to take the peace talks seriously, stop the scheduled and intentional murder of innocent civilians and allow for the implementation of much needed humanitarian aid. It would also be an effective first step in allowing Syrian refugees to return home.

Secondly we respectfully request that her Majesty's government petition the International Tribunal in the Hague to prosecute those who planned, ordered and willingly executed said warcrimes.

attributes.action: Amend Consumer Protection Act 1987 to include advice given by consumer experts
attributes.background: Advice given by travel consumer experts in the media is always minimal. So much information is omitted that if anyone follows the advice they may suffer financial losses. The CPA 1987 should be amended to force these experts to explain what risks are involved in following their suggestions.
attributes.additional_details:
E.g. - Ravi Rajani on ITV's Lorraine (11/8/16) 
He did not warn of the financial risk when booking travel separately. This is irresponsible coming so soon after the collapse of a holiday company with inadequate financial cover. A consumer champion should advise that the protection offered by the Package Travel, Package Holidays and Package Tours Regulations 1992 and Atol is far more important than saving pennies on the booking.

attributes.action: Increase government funding on organisations aiding terminal illness patients
attributes.background: Hospices and other organisations dedicate de to aiding those suffering from terminal illnesses such as dementia or cancer have been undervalued, either by a lack of pay or by an equal lack of resources, together we can increase welfare funding for such organisations such as these to beneficiaries.
attributes.additional_details: Organisations that enlist the aid of care professionals often being undervalued is often being seen in our headlines, our media is very biased in the covering of care workers and thus fewer people are as inclined to openly support the patients, their familles and carers through more comprehensive grief counselling and resources to truly allow these people a chance to live happily and find contentement despite any terminal illnesses.

attributes.action: Introduce a charge for travellers to pay for cleaning up once they have moved on
attributes.background: Some travellers who break into land cause damage which they do not have to pay for. This is wrong and creates a system with no incentive to stop them doing it again.
attributes.additional_details:
Around where we live land has been damaged including the local football field. It costs money to get court orders and repair the damage. 

All the council’s costs involved could and should be used for local people instead of wasted due to a lack of punishment to deter this behaviour.

attributes.action: Gov to guarantee that ex and current military personnel have homes to live in.
attributes.background:
Since 2013, up to 9,000 British heroes who have served for our country are homeless. Unfairly, our soldiers already fight in treacherous conditions for then to proceed to live in an environment which is inadequate. 
The government should make sure their lives are stabilised
attributes.additional_details: This current government are underserving an impoverished population.This should be prioritised as this creates and increases a despondent underclass

attributes.action: Brain scans for anyone entering  hospital with head injurys as protocol
attributes.background: When a person has an injury to their head the damage isn't always visible so let's spread the word to get brain scans offered as protocol to anyone entering the hospital with a head injury.
attributes.additional_details: Please help brain injuries get noticed quicker and before it totally changes a family's life by signing this petition, as recently a friend of mine lost their son due to a head injury which he was admitted to hospital with the staff stitched his head and discharged him hours later he was rushed in as collapsed and ended up in a

attributes.action: Increase funding for NHS England Gender Identity Clinics for adults
attributes.background: There are seven NHS England Gender Identity Clinics (GICs) for adults. Currently, there all of them have a waiting list of over a year from referral to first appointment. It can take months just for letters to be typed up and sent. Referrals are rising, and GICs need more funding to keep up.
attributes.additional_details:
Tavistock and Portman, England's only GIC for adolescents, recently received a large amount of funding to help it meet demand, but adult GICs have not been given the same aid.

Government guidelines dictate that no one should have to wait more than 18 weeks for an appointment, but GICs have not been provided with the resources needed to meet this target. Repeat appointments at Charing Cross GIC used to be 6 months apart, but are now closer to 9. Clinics also need more admin staff.

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to approve Nivolumab for lung cancer patients
attributes.background: Denied by Nice in England and Wales, this drug is freely available in Scotland. This drug could help cure patients suffering from Lung cancer, yet the government won't allow its use. Sign today lets start changing this disgrace immediately

attributes.action: Make individuals' contributions to the DFID International Aid budget voluntary
attributes.background: The international aid budget is out of control and management of it is not fit for purpose since much of it is wasted through ill advised means of spending or just plain poor management by, amongst others, unelected staff with their own agenda. Many UK citizens believe 'charity begins at home'.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing citizens to either 'opt in' or 'opt out' through their annual tax return, HMRC will still be able to collect the tax from those who wish to pay it while allowing others to pay their contribution to their preferred, domestic, budgets. Overall, the actual percentage size of the budget will reflect the proportion of citizens willing to pay for overseas aid.

attributes.action: Make student loan repayments tax deductible.
attributes.background:
Making student loan repayments after tax increases the cost of the debt to the student by around 30%.

Make student loan repayments tax deductible to improve the affordability of higher education.

attributes.action: NHS - Give more support to Young Adults
attributes.background: It is extremely worrying & stressful for anyone going to hospital, it is even worse for any young adult (aged 16-20) as whenever you go to clinic, operation or getting a referral done it is extremely difficult, as no one knows where to put you as technically you are too old for children's, but...
attributes.additional_details: ... but are also too young to be in the adults. This is worse when you become an inpatient and they don't know which ward to put you on, and neither is ideal. You spend long periods of uncertainty being passed from departments and you are just waiting for someone to give you the help & support you desperately need. This is a petition for the NHS to give more support and structure within the NHS for Young Adults, (one way do to this would be to introduce specific young adult clinics and wards)

attributes.action: Have a progressive capital gains tax in the U.K for high net worth individuals.
attributes.background: Only wealthy people make large gains on their assets; yet they pay the same as working people earning £11,000 to £43,000 per year; this is obviously unfair and perpetuates inequality. Let's create a fairer society where our taxes don't benefit the wealthy and everyone really pays their fair share.
attributes.additional_details:
The FTSE 100 average yearly gain is 5.4% (Motley Fool UK).  Yet average yearly earning income increases between 2001 and 2016 is just 2.3% (ONS). Clearly a CGT rate of 20% benefits the wealthy.
CGT shouldn't change for companies, only for high net worth individuals. Capital investment is essential to our economy; and individuals won't be put off investing if they have to pay 40% on their profits like everyone else. Changing CGT would improve inequality and provide revenue for the government.

attributes.action: Increase the fine on mobile phone use while driving to a minimum of £10,000
attributes.background: I'm sick of having near misses while cycling to and from work due to car drivers illegally using mobile phones while driving. This problem is becoming an epidemic, it's time to get tough on the law breakers who endanger innocent lives.

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of the Zeilsdorf Family from Laggan.
attributes.background: The family are waiting for imminent deportation as they have failed to meet the criteria of their Entrepreneur Visa by employing 2 people in their tiny shop and coffee bothy in Laggan. They do employ 1, they have 3 children, and take care of the local rural community by providing a valuable service.
attributes.additional_details: They are being forced to leave before they can sell. There's every chance that the business will not continue and the area will lose it's shop. Other similar services are tens of miles away. Their children are Scottish, they employ someone, and they make regular visits to local elderly and house bound people in the community as Jason was a Pastor. It is not the Highlands, Scotland or Scottish people who don't want and them; it is just the Home Office. We NEED them - sign  to keep the Zeilsdorfs.

attributes.action: Get the government to remove stamp duty from buy-to-let property
attributes.background: The btl mortgages have dropped 60% since April when George Osborne brought in the states on btl and 2nd homes. This is damaging the housing market and the rental market for both renters and 1st time buyers

attributes.action: Enforce harsher penalties for those who breach airports during protests
attributes.background: Recently, many "protesters" from environmental groups have been breaching airports and standing on runways. This is highly illegal, but they always leave with very small fines at worst.

attributes.action: Tackle the pay gap between men and women.
attributes.background:
According to AAUW, the pay gap won’t close until 2152 - lets change that.
Why should women be paid 20% less than a man doing exactly the same job?
Please sign this petition and help us take one more step towards gender equality.

attributes.action: House of Lords/Commons respect the will of people and not stop Article 50
attributes.background: In June the UK voters voted to leave the EU; we were told the result would stand but each day pro EU politicians and supporters try to block our democratic voice. I propose we sign this petition to show the will of the people must be carried out no matter what. Teresa May can invoke Article 50
attributes.additional_details: Todays proposal from the House of Lords just proves the establishment think their views are more important than the 17,410,742 million who voted to leave the EU in a valid referendum.

attributes.action: Press for social security & pension action in future agreements with South Korea
attributes.background: If a person works in South Korea for less than 10 years, their pensions contributions can never be cashed in. Thus, many years of contributions are lost. Also, the Korean government do not  consider  private teachers pension contributions as a part of the 10 years needed for a pension pay out.
attributes.additional_details: From a social justice perspective, this particularly affects British people who are less likely to be from the upper, upper middle or ruling classes in the UK, more likely to teach English in South Korea, and therefore less likely to have any company pension in Korea. This places these particular British people, who often leave university with huge debts, at a further monetary disadvantage. Any loss to pension contributions will cause significant financial stress on them and their dependents.

attributes.action: Bring the child victims of the Syrian conflict to the UK and Europe.
attributes.background: Every day for the past five years a child has lost its life due to the conflict. The world has stood by for way to long and watched children pay the price for adult wars! it is my belief we have a OBLIGATION to rescue and protect as many of these children as we can.
attributes.additional_details: It is only since the outrage over Aylan Kurdi and now Omran Daqneesh the world has woken up and realized what the Syrian people have been dealing with as daily life for five whole years. It is in my belief we should ALL be doing what we can to evacuate these children and home them in safe countries. They do not deserve to pay the price for adult wars and this MUST be stopped! There must be relief provided and as many children evacuated as possible. Thank you all for your support.

attributes.action: Ban the breeding and sale of Pugs, Bulldogs and Shar Peis in the UK
attributes.background: These breeds of dogs have many health problems and is unfair that they have to live like this. Therefore it should be illegal to breed or purchase these dogs.

attributes.action: We want to make a change to the government cuts towards disabled people.
attributes.background: NCS Wave 9 Black Country A Team Jackman are campaigning to help change the attitude of the government and where they place their money. They have cut back too much on the funding for the disabled and we want to make a change, this petition will help us make that difference that could change lives.
attributes.additional_details: We are working with our Patener charity Let Us Play, an organisation that works with disabled and vulnerable children from the ages 5-19. They do amazing work to help the children have a fun filled life. However they struggle to get the essentials that they need due to the government cuts towards disabled people for example, there used to be 27 rest bite beds in Wolverhampton alone and over the past few years it has reduced to 3. How unfair is that?

attributes.action: Reduce the payment of stamp duty to 0% for British Armed Forces personnel
attributes.background:
Armed Forces personnel, by virtue of work, are likely to move around more as a result of posting. Moving home every 2-3 years can be
costly incurring legal fees and tax. To reduce this cost, incured as a result of the employment, stamp duty could be reduced to 0% for residential property purchase
attributes.additional_details: With my current property 2 years on the market at a price below market value and still unable to sell. When I return from serving overseas I will incur 3% stamp duty to buy a new home close to where I work. I face this, paying full rent for a property or living in a single man room where I have little choice over food and little privacy, Im 43 I dont wish to live like a student, I would like to afford my own space.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate the misleading information by the EU Leave Campaign
attributes.background:
The nation's decision on Europe must be based wholly upon an informed choice and not upon misleading campaigns of false information provided by the Leave Campaign.
We ask such debate to take place in Parliament before any debate enacting Article 50 or any vote on it.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/16/nigel-farage-defends-ukip-breaking-point-poster-queue-of-migrants
http://m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_576e2967e4b08d2c56393241?edition=uk 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36353013
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6H8TA631ou0 and http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/eu-referendum-result-nigel-farage-nhs-pledge-disowns-350-million-pounds-a7099906.html
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/3-brexit-promises-campaigners-wriggled-8271762 and 
http://qz.com/715877/the-backtracking-on-promises-by-brexit-campaigners-has-already-begun/

attributes.action: Make work experience a compulsory part of the Yr 9 and Yr 11 curriculum again.
attributes.background: We are being made to make choices that may shape our entire career without having been given the opportunity to experience a working environment.  If work experience was compulsory we could experience different types of jobs and make informed choices about what qualifications we wanted to pursue.
attributes.additional_details: If 2 opportunities were given in Yr 9 and Yr 11 to undertake 2 weeks of work experience young people would be able to make better informed GCSE and A Level choices.  It would also allow them the opportunity to build their character by recognising what key skills they may need to develop further.  It also allows them potential segues into jobs when they reach school leaving age.  This opportunity for personal development should be just as essential as the rest of the curriculum.

attributes.action: STOP the closure of Rotherham main post office
attributes.background:
Rotherham as you know has had bad press,
For the people of  our town many things have disappeared that once made this town a good place to live, buildings pulled down without consulting the people, 
now the main Rotherham post office  (3-5 Bridgegate) is next to be hit,
please put a stop to this.
attributes.additional_details:
this post office is a necessity for the people of Rotherham.
a lot of people including the elderly  use this post office and in turn helps local trade as some have it as part of a day in the town center. it is necessary for passports, driving licenses, pensions ect ect, Rotherham as a town is slowly disappearing and it needs to be stopped, a once proud people are now seeing Rotherham town center disappear, contrary to popular belief not everyone has the internet and still need this post office

attributes.action: Payment terms exceeding 30 days from when an invoice is issued should be illegal
attributes.background: I am the director of a small electrical contracting company. It is about time something was done about the big company's who think it is acceptable to make smaller companies, especially in construction, wait ridiculous amounts of time for payment. Small businesses regularly go bust due to this.
attributes.additional_details: All company's from bottom of the pile to the top should be legally required to pay no later than 30 days from invoice

attributes.action: Remove the powers local authorities have to switch off street lights at  night.
attributes.background: Several authorities have switched off street lights at night, regardless of possible crime and safety consequences. The latest is Surrey County Council, to save £210,000 a year, a mere pittance in relative terms, and an amount that could surely be saved by, for example, axing the Chief Exec post.

attributes.action: Make MP's send yearly report to their constituents.
attributes.background: In a time of information and misinformation I propose that MP's send a report to each of their constituents outlying which bills they have voted for, against or abstained. Their attendance in office and parliament and their expenses.
attributes.additional_details: As public servants and representatives of the people, MP's should send information of what they have voted for (on our behalf), so we can decide if we choose to keep them in office. I am aware that this information is in the public domain, but is not readily available to us all. In a society where we celebrate  democracy, the MP's should be happy for us to see what they are doing and allow us to celebrate their achievements by voting them in next time.

attributes.action: All new public transport buses to be either electric or hydrogen fuel by 2018.
attributes.background: Health campaigners say Britain is facing an “air pollution crisis”.  It is estimated that the lives of 40,000 to 50,000 people in the UK are ended prematurely every year.  Yet technology exists to solve this problem.  By introducing new zero emission buses, dirty diesel buses will be phased out.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Service to calculate payments based on annual basic net pay.
attributes.background: Calculations shouldn't include overtime, shift allowances nor any bonuses.
attributes.additional_details: Receiving parents to provide evidence of what they spend child maintenance on

attributes.action: Make it UK law to label all consumer products as vegan/vegetarian/non-vegetarian
attributes.background: There has been numerous times when I have discovered (by contacting companies) a product is vegetarian, yet it is not disclosed on the packaging. Stating items as vegan/vegetarian or not should become a legal requirement as it would make it easier to purchase according to each individual lifestyle.
attributes.additional_details: This law should apply to ALL consumer products sold in the UK from food and drink to cosmetics and everyday essentials, such as toothpaste and hand wash.

attributes.action: Legislate the number of dogs that professional dog walkers can walk at one time
attributes.background: We want to ask the government to legislate the number of dogs that professional dog walkers are allowed to walk at any one time. To a maximum 3 dogs per each dog walker. This will be more beneficial for each dog, and the dog walker can promote responsible dog ownership/care.
attributes.additional_details: From our own personal experience we see on a daily basis dog walkers sometimes walking 4-6 dogs and more at any one time - Some of the walkers just allow the dogs to jump out of the cars in the car park area and run around out of control.  We question whether a dog walker with 4-6 dogs or more has total control for any eventuality - whether that be a pending dog fight, a dog running off or just being able to collect and dispose of their dogs poo. Logistically its practically impossible.

attributes.action: Government to Reconsider A Legal, Regulated Market for Medical Cannabis.
attributes.background: Government to reconsider A legal, regulated market for the consumption, sale and production of Medical Cannabis in the wake of the recent decision to legalise in a further 4 US states in November 2016. Taking into account evidence gathered by the Cross Party Group and Germany's decision to regulate.

attributes.action: Insurance for cyclists
attributes.background: Cyclists use the road on a day to day basis. If they use the road, they should have to pay for it like we do. If they crash into your car causing damage, you end up footing the cost and losing your No Claims Bonus. They should have their own insurance for using the road.
attributes.additional_details: A car is damaged by a cyclists cycling without due care and attention, who has to pay for the damage? You do through your insurance which has a great affect on you. If that was a car, their insurance would pay so therefore cyclists should be treated the same and have to have insurance to cover themselves. This also means obeying the rules of the road such as stopping at red-lights and not using bus lanes.

attributes.action: Make the day after Remembrance Sunday a Bank Holiday to honour our Armed Forces
attributes.background: The day after Remembrance Sunday should be made a Bank Holiday every year to honour Britain’s war dead and Armed Forces. Many other countries pay tribute to their Armed Forces with a national holiday including the United States, Canada, Russia, France and Israel.

attributes.action: Allow rape victims to receive forensic examination and results before reporting
attributes.background: Potential rape victims often can't find out whether they have ingested a date rape drug unless they take legal action and report the crime. This involves undergoing a 3 hour forensic examination, making a video statement, and the arrest of the accused. They may also be forced to appear in court.
attributes.additional_details: Date rape drugs leave the system within 72 hours of being ingested, and forensic examinations should be made within this time frame too, so that the victim can eat, drink and shower normally. The decision to report is heavy, and should be given time. When forced to make a decision so quickly, victims are often pressured into reporting their crimes when it isn't in their interest to do so. Victims should have the right to receive the forensic examination and its results before reporting.

attributes.action: Make Healthy start vouchers available to all low income families
attributes.background: Poverty does not only exist in non-working families. The ability to access fruit, vegetables and milk is essential but not always possible for low income families that work. Healthy growth and development should be of paramount importance for this government, allowing the working poor to thrive.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that if we can make this change we will reap the benefits as a nation within a small amount of time. We will see the general health of families on low incomes improving meaning less strain on our hospitals and doctors surgeries. People less likely to eat sweets and high sugar foods so will see an improvement in oral health the wider implications are endless.

attributes.action: Investigate the UK's role in launching airstrikes during the Syrian ceasefire
attributes.background: US Secretary of State John Kerry referred to the recent truce in Syria as the "last chance" for peace (1). Despite this, the UK "unintentionally" killed 62 Syrian soldiers in an airstrike during the ceasefire (2). We the undersigned demand to know how the UK put global stability at risk in this way.
attributes.additional_details:
The United Kingdom elected to become directly involved in the devastating Syrian conflict when our parliament voted in 2015 to join a coalition of nations performing airstrikes in the region(3).
Now we have broken a truce that our allies helped to establish.

(1) - http://news.sky.com/story/syria-ceasefire-begins-amid-concerns-from-rebel-groups-10575628
(2) - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-37409236
(3) - https://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2015/december/mps-debate-motion-on-isil-in-syria/

attributes.action: Stop UK Police from allowing officers to wear a burka
attributes.background: http://www.expressandstar.com/news/2016/09/09/west-midlands-police-officers-may-wear-burkas/

attributes.action: Vets to be regulated by a independent governing body impartially from the RCVS
attributes.background:
Vets are not regulated by any real governing body at present, and can charge as much as they like, and go back on their word. 
They can give the wrong advise to a owner which can be costly and put a animal through unnecessary treatments.
It needs to be regulated like all other services.
attributes.additional_details:
A vet can offer a service but then change their mind at a later date, for example offering to put a animal to sleep for free as they animal had surgery on their advice which made the situation worse and the animal to suffer more, and then charge the owner at a later date. 
Vets also prey on owners whose animal is sick and put profit ahead of the animals well being, and the RCVS can do little to help.
They are not answerable to anything and this needs to change.

attributes.action: The U.K. Military should under no circumstances engage in the defence of Turkey
attributes.background: Given the recent provocative attacks of Turkey in the Middle East and provocations against Russia from Turkey the UK should not deploy any of its military forces as part of a NATO defence of turkey should they be counter attacked by countries that Turkey is antagonising.

attributes.action: Provide legislation to maintain the same level of weekly waste uplift everywhere
attributes.background: Argyll and Bute are cutting green bin waste collections by a third in Kintyre without providing a safe, secure or easily accesible alternative which has lead to feelings of insecurity, people buying bins out of their own pocket when they already pay council tax.
attributes.additional_details: Aim of this petiiton is to provide legislation to maintain the same level of weekly waste uplift in each area (I.e if an area was originally green bin only at 140l weekly and then becomes 2/3 weekly still at 140l the council must provide other recycling bins that add up to the same total of 140l a week) So a 2 weekly collection would be 2 bins at 140l (one recycling, one not) 3 weekly would be 3 140l or 1 140l and 1 280l.

attributes.action: Stop legally classifying pets as property.
attributes.background: Pets are not property. They are loving companions, family members, they can perform important tasks. The theft, abuse, murder of pets causes deep psycological and emotional distress and crimes against people's pets must be taken extremely seriously in court and perpetrators severely punished.

attributes.action: Pay student nurses a wage whilst on placement during their nursing degree
attributes.background: Student nurses are expected to work full time (37.5 hours a week) with no income to show for their hard work. Due to working full time, they are then limited to finding paid work outside of placement time. On top of this, they are also having to study for a degree like all other full time students.

attributes.action: Discipline and fine MP's who sleep during in session parliamentary proceedings.
attributes.background: As private sector employees would face disciplinary proceedings if they were found to be sleeping on the job, the British government should have rules in place to discipline and substantially fine MP's who sleep on the job.  Numerous photos and videos have emerged of MP's sleeping in parliament.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that schools, colleges & staff working with children know CPR
attributes.background:
After reading so many stories this week, both positive and negative, people are still dying because of the lack of basic first aid training

Hopefully this will go to the government and ask why schools, colleges and people that work with children aren't being taught CPR & the importance of it.
attributes.additional_details:
Making this compulsory, will not only save someone's life if the need arises, but will make people aware of the need for training. 

Being an aspiring Paramedic, I know the importance of bystander CPR, as it increases the percentage of someone being saved and regaining life.
